invoke.input_question: By how much did NVIDIA's GAAP Research and Development expense exceed AMD's in fiscal year 2024, using only the "Research and development" line item from each company's latest Form 10-K filed with the SEC? Answer with a single number in USD billions, rounded to one decimal.

info.tool_calls:
[ToolCallingRecord(tool_name='scale_search_sync', args={'query': 'NVIDIA Form 10-K fiscal 2024 research and development expense', 'max_results': 5}, result=[{'title': 'NVIDIA Announces Financial Results for Fourth Quarter and Fiscal ...', 'url': 'https://nvidianews.nvidia.com/news/nvidia-announces-financial-results-for-fourth-quarter-and-fiscal-2024', 'content': "- NVIDIA's research and development expenses for fiscal 2024 are not explicitly detailed in the provided document. However, it mentions that total operating expenses for the fiscal year are expected to be approximately $3.5 billion in GAAP terms and $2.5 billion in non-GAAP terms for the first quarter of fiscal 2025. The document does not provide a specific figure for research and development expenses for fiscal 2024.", 'engine': 'tavily_search', 'engines': ['tavily_search']}, {'title': 'nvda-20240428 - SEC.gov', 'url': 'https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1045810/000104581024000124/nvda-20240428.htm', 'content': "- The document does not contain specific information regarding NVIDIA's research and development expenses for fiscal year 2024. It primarily discusses financial results for the first quarter of fiscal year 2025 and includes various financial statements and operational details. For the most accurate and detailed information regarding research and development expenses for fiscal year 2024, it is recommended to refer to NVIDIA's Annual Report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended January 28, 2024, as mentioned in the document.", 'engine': 'exa_search', 'engines': ['exa_search']}, {'title': 'Nvidia R&D expenses FY2024 | Statista', 'url': 'https://www.statista.com/statistics/988048/nvidia-research-and-development-expenses/', 'content': "- Nvidia's research and development (R&D) expenses for the fiscal year 2024 were 8.7 billion U.S. dollars. This figure represents a significant investment in R&D as the company continues to expand its focus beyond gaming into artificial intelligence (AI) technologies.", 'engine': 'exa_search', 'engines': ['exa_search']}], tool_call_id='call_E7xjeQxZhZKO6I2k6kSK9Ylh', images=None), ToolCallingRecord(tool_name='scale_search_sync', args={'query': 'site:sec.gov NVIDIA Form 10-K 2024 research and development', 'max_results': 5}, result=[{'title': 'nvda-20240128 - SEC.gov', 'url': 'https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1045810/000104581024000029/nvda-20240128.htm', 'content': "- NVIDIA Corporation has invested over $45.3 billion in research and development since its inception, which has led to significant innovations in computing technologies. The company has pioneered the GPU, which has transformed various industries, including gaming, AI, and scientific computing. In fiscal year 2024, NVIDIA's Compute & Networking segment saw a substantial increase in revenue, primarily driven by the demand for its data center products, including the NVIDIA Hopper GPU platform, which is optimized for training and inference of large language models (LLMs) and generative AI applications. The company reported a 266% increase in Compute revenue and a 133% increase in Networking revenue, reflecting the growing need for advanced computing solutions across various sectors.

NVIDIA's research and development efforts are focused on enhancing its accelerated computing platform, which includes GPUs, CPUs, and DPUs, to address the needs of AI, data analytics, and other compute-intensive workloads. The company has also launched several new products and services, including NVIDIA DGX Cloud, an AI-training-as-a-service platform, and NVIDIA AI Foundations, which help businesses create and operate custom AI models.

The company's commitment to innovation is evident in its development of software stacks that run on top of its GPUs, enabling applications in diverse fields such as healthcare, automotive, and professional visualization. NVIDIA's platforms are designed to support a wide range of applications, from gaming to autonomous driving, and the company continues to expand its ecosystem by collaborating with various partners and developers.

Overall, NVIDIA's focus on research and development is integral to its strategy of maintaining leadership in the rapidly evolving fields of AI and accelerated computing, ensuring that it can meet the demands of its customers and adapt to changing market conditions.", 'engine': 'tavily_search', 'engines': ['tavily_search']}, {'title': 'nvda-20240428 - SEC.gov', 'url': 'https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1045810/000104581024000124/nvda-20240428.htm', 'content': "- The document is NVIDIA Corporation's Form 10-Q for the quarter ended April 28, 2024. It includes financial statements and discussions regarding the company's performance, including research and development (R&D) expenses. 

For the first quarter of fiscal year 2025, NVIDIA reported an increase in R&D expenses primarily driven by a $482 million increase in compensation and benefits, which includes stock-based compensation reflecting employee growth and compensation increases. Additionally, there was a $242 million increase in compute and infrastructure investments. 

The document emphasizes NVIDIA's commitment to R&D, particularly in areas such as AI, data science, and generative AI applications, which are critical to their product offerings and future growth. The company has expanded its product portfolio to include new solutions that support these initiatives. 

Overall, the R&D expenses reflect NVIDIA's strategy to invest heavily in innovation and technology development to maintain its competitive edge in the rapidly evolving tech landscape.", 'engine': 'tavily_search', 'engines': ['tavily_search']}, {'title': 'now-20241231 - SEC.gov', 'url': 'https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1373715/000137371525000010/now-20241231.htm', 'content': "- The document provides detailed information about NVIDIA's research and development (R&D) expenses for the fiscal year ending December 31, 2024. It states that R&D expenses increased by $419 million compared to the previous year, primarily due to an increase in headcount, which resulted in higher personnel-related costs, including stock-based compensation and overhead expenses.
